message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR, cs.MM 

The paper deals with 3D human pose estimation from multiple 2D views, which is a problem in computer vision. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also proposes novel learnable triangulation methods, which involve optimization and machine learning techniques, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely sub-category. The paper also mentions the use of confidence weights and a human pose prior, which are related to probabilistic reasoning and artificial intelligence, respectively, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) another possible sub-category. The paper also involves volumetric aggregation and 3D convolutions, which are related to computer graphics and geometric modeling, making cs.GR (Computer Graphics) another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with multi-view 3D human pose estimation, which is related to video analysis and motion capture, making cs.MM (Multimedia) another possible sub-category.
